title: Sri Lanka rupee at 367 to TT dollar, interbank rupee at 360.27
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 367 against telegraphic transfers on Monday (06) while the central bank interbank spot trade was at 360.27 under a daily guidance rate.
Commercial banks were quoting 357/367 for telegraphic transfer dollars on Monday, moving up from last week.
The central bank’s daily guidance margin on the previous day was 1.00 rupees plus or 4.00 minus from the initial 2.50 rupees.

The central bank stopped quoting day rates on January 23 when the rupee was floated with an interest rate correction after the soft peg collapsed, amid a war. In 2021 and the central bank also started enforcing a rate incompatible with the policy rate at around 203 to the US dollar.
In the money markets, there was active trading following last week’s primary bills auction.
On Monday, a bond maturing on 01.06.2025 is at 22.10/25 percent, up from 22.00/15 percent on Friday.
A 6-year bond maturing on 15.01.2028 was quoted at 22.00/20.
The one year T-bills were quoted at 23.00/23.10 percent on Monday.
Following a tax hike last week, the weekly T-bill yields too eased.
The 83 billion T-bill auction was fully subscribed with the 3-month yields dropping 90-basis points.
The 6-months fell 62 basis points while the 12-months eased 55 basis points.
